alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 2:30PM CST until January 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Wintry Mix Southeast Overnight into Monday Morning... .A light wintry mix of freezing rain or sleet is expected southeast late tonight into Monday morning. While any ice or sleet accumulations should be light, they may still be sufficient for slick roads and travel impacts. Another system will approach the region Monday evening into Tuesday with another batch of frozen precipitation. Please continue to monitor the latest forecast for information on this system. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations less than one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Decatur County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
